page.title: 06BRIGHTLEY HAMLET
page.content: In{Brightley}there used to be a monastery.The small citizen priory was founded by Richard Pitz Baldwin in 1133.In 1136 twelve superior monks arrived from Waverley Abbey but the death of their first prior,together with the{damp climate}discouraged them so much they moved to Forde Abbey in Tavistock in 1141. King Henry 8th sacked all the monasteries so the monks went to the Isles of Scilly. Then the{monastery became a farm. Inside the piggery there is still the arch from the monastery. There was a mill too at the same time as the farm but it is now a {toy factory.} There are still the old mill stones but they are used for steps now. In a field opposite the factory Roman soldiers have been seen marching then they disappear. .
